summary: This is an FBI Daily News Briefing email from January 8, 2024, summarizing national and international news relevant to the FBI. It includes a section on criminal investigations noting the release of nearly 3,000 pages of Jeffrey Epstein documents, stating that some questions remain unanswered and that the documents shed little new light on his abuse of underage girls. It also references a lawyer urging the FBI to release CCTV footage potentially showing Prince Andrew at Epstein's mansion.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of the release of nearly 3,000 pages of court documents related to his case, with the briefing noting the documents shed little new light on his habitual sexual abuse of underage girls.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as the defendant in a 2015 civil defamation suit brought by an accuser, who alleged Maxwell aided in Epstein's abuse.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Referenced in relation to a lawyer urging the FBI to release CCTV footage that could show him at Epstein's mansion, following the release of new records detailing his connections to Epstein.

persons.name: Spencer Kuvin
persons.context: A lawyer representing nine Epstein victims who is urging the FBI to release CCTV footage from Epstein's mansion.

persons.name: Merrick Garland
persons.context: Mentioned in multiple news items within the briefing, primarily for convening a panel on violent crime and commenting on threats against public servants.

persons.name: Lisa Monaco
persons.context: Mentioned as participating with AG Garland in addressing violent crime and threats against public servants.

persons.name: Jack Smith
persons.context: Mentioned regarding spending on Trump investigations and responding to Trump's legal team in the Jan. 6 election interference case.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned frequently in sections about Special Counsel spending, Supreme Court ballot eligibility, Jan. 6 investigations, and related political news.

persons.name: Mike Pence
persons.context: Mentioned for denouncing a debunked FBI Jan. 6 conspiracy theory promoted by Trump.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Referenced in a quote about elevated threat levels and denying FBI involvement in instigating the Jan. 6 Capitol attack.

persons.name: Dawn N. Ison
persons.context: Announced the sentencing of a Michigan man for child pornography offenses.

persons.name: Cheyvoryea Gibson
persons.context: Quoted regarding the FBI's commitment to protecting children from predators following a sentencing.

persons.name: Dan Scavino
persons.role: Former Deputy Chief of Staff to President Trump
persons.context: Mentioned as a source for Special Counsel Jack Smith's investigation into Trump's inaction during the Jan. 6 attack.

persons.name: Jacob Chansley
persons.context: Mentioned for demanding the FBI return his horned headdress seized after the Capitol riot.

persons.name: Ashli Babbitt
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to a $30 million wrongful death lawsuit filed over her shooting by Capitol Police.

persons.name: Lt. Michael Byrd
persons.context: Named as the officer who shot Ashli Babbitt, subject of a wrongful death lawsuit.

connections.description: Maxwell was Epstein's former girlfriend and was accused of aiding in his sexual abuse of minors, as referenced in a 2015 civil defamation suit.

The document references newly released records detailing Prince Andrew's connections to Epstein, and a lawyer's call for the FBI to release CCTV footage potentially showing Andrew at Epstein's mansion.
Kuvin is an attorney who has represented nine victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
Special Counsel Jack Smith is investigating and has indicted former President Trump on charges related to classified documents and election interference.
Pence, as former Vice President, denounced a conspiracy theory about the Jan. 6 attack that was promoted by Trump.
Scavino was Trump's former deputy chief of staff and provided information to Special Counsel Jack Smith about Trump's actions on Jan. 6.

events.title: Release of FBI Daily News Briefing
events.description: The FBI's Office of Public Affairs distributes its daily news briefing covering a wide range of topics including the Epstein document release, Jan. 6 investigations, and other criminal and national security matters.

events.title: Court Order to Unseal Epstein Documents
events.description: A judge ordered the unsealing of documents from a 2015 civil defamation suit involving Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, leading to the release of nearly 3,000 pages.

events.title: January 6 Capitol Attack
events.description: The briefing contains multiple news items referencing the third anniversary of the attack, ongoing investigations, prosecutions, and political debates surrounding the event.

keyFacts: The document is an FBI Daily News Briefing from January 8, 2024, summarizing news of interest to the FBI.
It notes the release of nearly 3,000 pages of Jeffrey Epstein court documents but states they shed little new light on his abuse of underage girls.
It references a lawyer for Epstein victims urging the FBI to release CCTV footage that could show Prince Andrew at Epstein's mansion.
The briefing contains extensive coverage of the third anniversary of the Jan. 6 Capitol attack, including investigations, prosecutions, and political rhetoric.
It mentions Special Counsel Jack Smith's spending on Trump investigations and his probe into Trump's inaction during the Jan. 6 attack.
